page.title: 01 General Introduction
page.content: This is part of the Isle of Thanet in North East Kent in the South East of Britain. Originally there were small fishing villages like Broadstairs and farming settlements like St.Peters inland. During the present century this area of top quality farmland has been reduced as the settlements have expanded to merge with each other and extend northwards to Reading Street and Kingsgate. At the same time Margate spread eastward along the cliff top to form Cliftonville. Millmead and St.Peters estates are mostly post war buildings. Large areas of open farmland still remain below North Foreland lighthouse and along St.Peters footpath and towards Westwood. An industrial estate has developed atWestwood between the A254 and the old railway line.
